intro: Polygala selaginoides, commonly known as the silverleaf milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in a silvery bloom of fine hairs. The plant produces delicate, pinkish-white flowers that are arranged in spikes, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
